content: I think I prefer the old recipient bar look; i.e. I'd much rather a few wasted pixels than the current unstyled/boxy look. How are others feeling? My preference would be to revert to the old style for 1.7, and then work on fixing the search bar issues for 1.8.
I feel like it is almost unneeded, considering the sticky headers exist.
I think the whole top row needs rethinking, looks too much like 'boxes some devs put stuff into', which is likely what happened ;)
I have never liked the business and noise of showing the search with the advanced search query in it
It needs at least some padding to the left and to the right. I agree it is not necessarily better, but also I wouldn't say it is worse than before. Just bad (as before)

I would suggest a rethinking, I definitely like the Stride's one better:
https://techcrunch.com/2017/09/07/atlassian-launches-stride-its-slack-competitor/
Generally too many duplications in the UI, for example, there are two search icons and two settings icons on screen

For context, Zulip nav bar and Slack nav bar, both from medium width:

pasted image

pasted image
Oh I didn't even notice the bar was changed
Thanks for the screenshots. They illustrate quite well the noise we add to the search bar

In that case showing 

#commits
python-zulip-api....

on two lines, plus some icons or other info like user count, exactly like what Slack does looks quite superior to our approach
I also don't think we need the 'Zulip' text and just the logo will suffice
Yeah, I think everyone agrees that we need to get rid of the duplication in the current recipient bars.

I think the current best theory for what to do as the next step is to remove the duplication by having it be encoded as bubbles. We should probably finish that change and then start thinking about how to add info like subscriber counts and stream description.
